paragraph: Russell Gunn (born October 20, 1971 in Chicago) is an American contemporary jazz trumpeter. He grew up in East St. Louis, Illinois playing trumpet. As a kid his musical interest was hip hop, with LL Cool J being his first music idol. His projects include a large ensemble called Bionic, which released an album called Krunk Jazz, and his smaller group Electrik Butterfly.
2004 - Ethnomusicology, Vol. 4: Live in Atlanta (Justin Time)
2006 - Russell Gunn Presents... Bionic: Krunk Jazz (Groid)
2010 - Ethnomusicology, Vol. 6: Return of Gunn Fu (Groid)
2013 - Russell Gunn & Elektrik Butterfly: Elektrik Funeral (Hot Shoe Music)As sideman and co-leader
1994 - Oliver Lake: Dedicated to Dolphy (Black Saint)
1994 - Wynton Marsalis: Blood on the Fields (Columbia)
